Class InvitedEntrantsFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
com.example.ajilore.code.ui.events.list.InvitedEntrantsFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
public class InvitedEntrantsFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
InvitedEntrantsFragment

Displays a realtime list of entrants whose status is "invited". These users have been invited to an event but have not yet responded.

This fragment reads from the top-level Firestore collection:

 entrants (collection)
    ├── {uid} (document)
    │     ├── status = "invited"
    │     ├── invitedDate : Timestamp

Features:

  • Realtime Firestore listener for invited entrants
  • Sorted by invitedDate in descending order
  • Displays results using EntrantAdapter in "invited" mode
  • Handles empty state messaging and loading spinner visibility
  • Supports future expansion for detailed entrant actions

This screen is typically used by event organizers reviewing who has been formally invited but has not yet accepted or declined their participation.
